Confirmation from journalists in Minneso: but did not entirely eliminate it.
The program in question was called Gener: which provided health insurance for very low-income adults who were not eligible for federal Medicaid.
Pawlenty proposed changes to the program: including transferring some beneficiaries to a different program called MinnesotaCare that required premiums. Advocates for the poor and hospital officials expressed concerns about the potential devastating impact of these cuts.
